info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 5:28AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS WITH DRIFTING SNOW AND ICY ROADS POSSIBLE... Locally strong and gusty winds continue this morning along the eastern slopes of the Sisseton Hills, with southwest winds of 25 to 40 mph with occasional higher gusts. The locations most affected will be the higher terrain areas of the Sisseton Hills as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This includes Interstate 29 between Summit and Sisseton. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank may also experience strong winds. The winds are expected to gradually diminish through the morning hours. The strong winds will lead to primarily drifting snow, but when combined with temperatures in the upper 20s, the snow has been sticking to some roads and leading to icy spots. There may be very localized areas where the snow is lofted and reducing visibilities, primarily along I-29 near the Wilmot exit. Anyone with travel plans across far northeast South Dakota should be prepared for inclement weather and are urged to slow down and allow for extra distance between vehicles if need be.
